issue.title: function<void(ArgTypes...)> does not discard the return value of the target object

discussion.p: function<void(ArgTypes...)> should discard the return value of the target object. This behavior was in the original proposal, and it was removed (accidentally?) by the resolution of LWG .
This side-effect was indeed not intended by .

blockquote.p: A callable object f of type F is Callable for argument types ArgTypes and return type R if the expression INVOKE(f, declval<ArgTypes>()..., R), considered as an unevaluated operand (Clause 5), is well formed () and, if R is not void, implicitly convertible to R.
